eadid.publicid: -//State of Utah::Utah State Archives and Records Service//TEXT (US::U-Ar::U-Ar_11977.xml::Lucybeth Rampton's portrait)//EN

titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of Lucybeth Rampton's portrait from Governor Rampton, ca. 1965.
titlestmt.author: Utah State Archives and Records Service
titlestmt.sponsor: Library Services and Technology Act (LSTA) grant, 2007-2008

publicationstmt.publisher: Utah State Archives and Records Service

profiledesc.creation: This series was processed by Kira Robertson in 02/2001. Encoding system was created by Elizabeth Perkes in December 2007..
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid written in English in Latin script.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

change.item: Finding aid reviewed for DACS and Utah Manuscript Association Best Practice Guidelines by Jim Kichas.

repository.corpname: Utah State Archives and Records Service

did.abstract: This series contains a framed photographic portrait of Lucybeth Rampton, wife of Governor Calvin Rampton (term: 1965-1977). The photograph is undated and was taken by Jay Lynn.
did.physloc: These records are housed in the Utah State Archives' permanent storage room.

scopecontent.p: This series contains a framed photographic portrait of Lucybeth Rampton, wife of Governor Calvin Rampton (term: 1965-1977). The photograph is undated and was taken by Jay Lynn.

accessrestrict.p: This series is classified as Public.

userestrict.p: These records are available for reproduction and use.

prefercite.p: Cite the Utah State Archives and Records Service, the creating agency name, the series title, and the series number.

custodhist.p: Transferred to the Archives from the Governor's Mansion in 1993.

acqinfo.p: These records were acquired from the creating agency through established retention schedules.

processinfo.p: This series was processed by Kira Robertson in February 2001.

relatedmaterial.p: Mrs. George Clyde portrait from the Governor Clyde, Series 23566, Mrs. Clyde and Mrs. Rampton apparently had their portraits done at the same time. Governor Clyde was Governor Rampton's immediate predecessor.
